snippet: Latisha Fisher, who was taking medication to treat her paranoid schizophrenia and had started community college classes, locked herself and her son in the restroom of a Midtown restaurant.
abstract: Latisha Fisher of Manhattan is charged with murder of her 1-year-old son after she locked herself in restroom of Midtown hamburger restaurant with him and refused help while he lost consciousness; police have not said publicly how child was killed; she had been taking medication for her paranoid schizophrenia and had begun community college classes.

byline.original: By VIVIAN YEE and NATE SCHWEBER
byline.contributor: Al Baker, Marc Santora and Michael Schwirtz contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Latisha Fisher, who was taking medication to treat her paranoid schizophrenia and had started community college classes, locked herself and her son in the restroom of a Midtown restaurant.

headline.main: Fleeting Stability for a Woman Charged With Killing Her Son
headline.print_headline: Fleeting Stability for a Woman Charged With Killing Her Son
